description: Borrowed from French brouhaha, but disputed as to where from before that. Possibly from Hebrew בָּרוּךְ הַבָּא‎ (barúkh habá, “welcome”, literally “blessed is he who comes”).

entries.meaning: A stir; a fuss or uproar.
examples: Synonyms: commotion, hubbub, kerfuffle; see also Thesaurus:commotion
